it.polito.nffg.neo4j.resources

Class GraphResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.nffg.neo4j.resources.GraphResource

  • public class GraphResource
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines the methods that are mapped to HTTP request at path '/graphs/graphId'.

    • Method Detail

      • getGraph

        @GET
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public Nffg getGraph()
              throws MyGenericException
        Method associated with HTTP GET. It's used to retrieve a requested graph.
        Returns:
        the requested graph.
        Throws:
        MyNotFoundException - if there is no graph whose id is equal to the passed one.
        MyGenericException - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        Nffg, @GET, @Produces, MyNotFoundException, MyGenericException

      • getPaths

        @GET
@Path(value="paths")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public Paths getPaths(@DefaultValue(value="both")@QueryParam(value="dir")
                               java.lang.String dir,
                               @DefaultValue(value="src_x")@QueryParam(value="src")
                               java.lang.String src,
                               @DefaultValue(value="dst_y")@QueryParam(value="dst")
                               java.lang.String dst)
               throws MyGenericException
        Method associated with HTTP GET. It's used to retrieve all paths from a source node to a destination one within the graph specified in the URL.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction considered in the calculation of paths (possible values are 'incoming', 'outgoing' and 'both').
        src - the id of the source node.
        dst - the id of the destination node.
        Returns:
        the retrieved paths.
        Throws:
        MyNotFoundException - if there is no graph whose id is equal to the taken from URL one, or if this problem affects the source node or the destination one.
        MyConstraintViolationException - if the value of direction isn't admissible.
        MyGenericException - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        @GET, @Path, @Produces, Paths, @DefaultValue, @QueryParam, String, MyNotFoundException, MyConstraintViolationException, MyGenericException

      • getProperty

        @GET
@Path(value="property")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public Property getProperty(@DefaultValue(value="reachability")@QueryParam(value="name")
                                     java.lang.String prop,
                                     @DefaultValue(value="both")@QueryParam(value="dir")
                                     java.lang.String dir,
                                     @DefaultValue(value="src_x")@QueryParam(value="src")
                                     java.lang.String src,
                                     @DefaultValue(value="dst_y")@QueryParam(value="dst")
                                     java.lang.String dst)
                     throws MyGenericException
        Method associated with HTTP GET. It's used to check whether a property on a given graph is satisfied or not. For the moment, the only property supported is 'reachability'.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction considered to determine whether a destination node is reachable from a source one or not (possible values are 'incoming', 'outgoing' and 'both').
        src - the id of the source node.
        dst - the id of the destination node.
        Returns:
        an object of the JAXB annotated HttpMessage class that contains the response.
        Throws:
        MyNotFoundException - if there is no graph whose id is equal to the taken from URL one, or if this problem affects the source node or the destination one.
        MyConstraintViolationException - if the value of direction isn't admissible or if this problem affect the property.
        MyGenericException - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        @GET, @Path, @Produces, Property, @DefaultValue, @QueryParam, String, MyNotFoundException, MyConstraintViolationException, MyGenericException

      • deleteGraph

        @DELETE
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteGraph()
                                      throws MyGenericException
        Method associated with HTTP DELETE. It's used to delete a graph.
        Returns:
        an empty No_Content Response.
        Throws:
        MyNotFoundException - if there is no graph whose id is equal to the taken from URL one.
        MyGenericException - in case of any other unpredictable errors.
        See Also:
        @DELETE, Response, MyNotFoundException, MyGenericException
